ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a deeper interest and understanding of Foucault through this course, as well as a more well-rounded interpretation of current events, using various philosophical/theoretical lenses of communal power, sedition, and progress, through conversations with the professor and other students.
I learned a lot about the nuances between what is truth and what is sedition, and why this has been an issue that has plagued governments forever.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of this course is in the texts we read (extremely engaging!) and free-flowing discussion. While the professor's structured introduction of topics sometimes limited the freedom of the discussion, his unique perspective on the texts we read challenged us to make complex/obscure connections to them that we might not have otherwise seen.

I think it's a great class. Strengths are the readings are not too bad and very interesting, and Prof. Klein is great. Weaknesses are the class is a bit disorganized, but I think it's because Prof. Klein is always willing to keep talking about something interesting and accordingly adjusts the syllabus.

The course content was fascinating, interesting and well-designed. I truly enjoyed doing the readings and having enriching discussions on truth with my peers and Prof. Klein, who provided great insights about the subject. Learning about parrhesia was particularly meaningful. However, it would have been beneficial for the class to have been more structured and to have followed a clearer outline.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to a student willing to take their learning into their own hands; this course only gives you as much as you give it!
Definitely! Prof. Klein is wonderful, insightful, and a very nice person and grader. The topics are really interesting and worth diving into.
